channel.title: Productivity in Tech Podcast
channel.description: Jay Miller sits down with people in tech that love what they and figures out how the secret to how they get it all done!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learning Productivity from People like Us!

item.title: PIT 61: Podcast Out Nerd Out with Kenneth Rotter
item.description:
Kenneth from the Dumbells and Dragons Podcast¬†and I talk about podcasting, fitness, and nerd out on some things that we are excited about.

Podcast Tip

  • Have a Warchest (Content that you can release at anytime) This episode and my interviews with Rob Freelow are great examples Warchest Episodes.
  • Know all the surrounding factors when scheduling
  • Be as flexible as possible.

What is Kenneth Nerding out On

  • Books
    • Wicked
    • Total Recall
  • Comics
    • Saga
    • Rat Queens
    • PaperGirls
    • Episode with Karen Young
  • Movies
    • Guardians 2
  • TV
    • The Get Down
    • Bill Nye Saves the World
    • Tyler the Creator's Interview on Bill Nye the Science Guy

Links of Note

  • Interview with Carl Pullein
  • Overdrive
  • Gorillaz Converse All-Stars

Follow Kenneth

  • Follow @DumbellsDragon
  • Check out Dumbells and Dragons

item.title: PIT 60: Creating a Compassionate Environment with April Wensel
item.description:
April Wensel

April is the founder of Compassionate Coding.

I met april at a WeAll.Js event and loved the idea of a company that helps to encourages businesses to take inclusion in the development space seriously.

I believe that areas that are the most inclusive are the most productive and I applaud April for all the things she is doing in the space.

Running Compassionate Coding

  • Staying involved in coding communities and volunteer opportunities helping others learn to code.
  • Consistent Structure helps to maintain routine.
  • Use Tools like Trello to organize projects.
  • Use previous experience to launch your plans for entrepreneurship.

What to do if you Company isn't Compassionate?

  • Speak up about the issues that you are dealing with. Don't be afraid of being labeled a troublemaker.
  • Get Out (if you can)

Looking for Compassionate Companies

  • Ask questions in low pressure situations (Job/Career Fairs)
  • Don't do interviews just for practice.
  • Use the interview process to gauge the company (regardless of what they tell you the culture is like).
  • Look at who is interviewing you. If there is no diversity in the panel, be sure to bring up the question of diversity.
  • Look for companies that are transparent about their inclusion.

Leveling the Playing Field

  • Businesses - Look at candidates based on their the willingness to grow at the role.
  • Judge candidates by what they show you in outside of their resume.
  • Take an interest in the person's situation. This can shed light on any "lacking" areas.

Be Humble

  • Businesses - Don't be a Snake Oil Salesmen

You can find out more about what April and compassionate coding are doing through:

  • @aprilwensel
  • @compassioncode
  • Compassionate Coding
item.itunes:keywords: inclusivity, development, jobs, hiring, job search

item.title: PIT 59: Freedom with Shenomad's Founder LaToya Allen
item.description:
LaToya Allen - SheNomads

  • SheNomads
  • @shenomads
  • SheNomads Study Group
  • SheNomads Podcast

Tips for People Thinking about Becoming a Nomad

  • Find other Nomads and talk with them (Like in a Nomad Community üòâ)
  • Try working remote a few days and see if it works for you
  • Talk with your boss and see if you can start working remote for 1-2 days a week and then slowly work towards being remote full-time
  • Look for jobs that cater to Remote Workers
    • Remote OK
    • We Work Remotely

Tips for Current Nomdads

  • cheapoair
  • Get plugged into communities (like she nomads)
  • Go to lots of Conferences
  • Take advantage of study groups
  • Use anti-distraction tools to achieve a state of flow
    • Noisli
    • Forest App

Other Links of Note

  • Ana Mascara - PART 1: The Ultimate Guide to Motivation - YouTube

item.title: PIT 54: Two Slightly Agitated Mac Nerds with Tiffany White
item.description:
What makes your project really successful? Tiffany and Jay break down the frustrations in the online productivity community and the vipers that exist in it.

They also talk about doing what you love for the sake of loving it and how to properly monetize it.

Most importantly, they catch up and see what has changed since their last big chat.

item.title: PIT 47: Making Things Out with Joe Zack
item.description:
Joe Zack

Who am I? Senior Software Engineer and Co-Host of Coding Blocks Podcast

Aligning incentives:

  • "Bundle" activities - Audiobooks + Cleaning
  • Reward yourself for an activity (#imadethis, logging (Seinfeld thing))
  • Letting yourself feel good about your accomplishments (Gratitude Journal, Lee Stetson)
  • Don't reward yourself too early...but don't shy away from mutually assured accountability (Coach!)
  • Join constructive community: You're the average of the 5 people you hang out with (PIT Facebook group, Slack Group, Co-Hosts)

References: (Pop'Sci' Books)

  • Hello Tech Pros http://hellotechpros.com/
  • Power of Habit
    • Getting Things Done (Important / Urgent)
    • Shooting the bears instead of the bees (Focusing on Important over Urgent)

Things I need to get better about

  • Being organized in the "real world"
  • Don't lose site of the foreset for the trees!
  • CodeWars

  • 100DaysOfCode (CodeNewbie)

Turning it arround: Is it an Extroverts world?

  • checkout PIT on "Priority Matrix" / Myers Briggs
  • Introvert in some areas, extra in others
  • bar w/ friends vs code/boardgames

Find me @codingblocks on twitter

item.title: PIT 41: Growing up with Systems and Literate Chickens
item.description:
Wilsar Johnson is a Social Media Rep for a Washington DC Representative. When not shaking the nation one tweet at a time, she is enjoying Western African Films for her podcast Sugercane Cinema, or searching for the some of the best Black influencers and podcasters for her websites Melanin Habits and Support Black Podcasters.

In this conversation we talk about some of the quirky habits she picked up growing up in Sierra Leone, and how she still uses some of them, like time-batching (time-chunking), today.

Wilsar Johnson

  • @CallMeWilsar
  • SugarCane Cinema
  • @supportblackpodcasts
  • SupportBlackPodcasts.com
  • Melanin Habits

item.title: PIT 31: SPECIAL EDITION - The Trigg Life Mapper
item.itunes:subtitle: This week I am releasing a special edition of the¬†Productivity in Tech Podcast. I got to ¬†review the Trigg Life Mapper¬†and I thought we would do a special episode in honor of their KickStarter starting September 20th. The Trigg Life...
item.description:
This week I am releasing a special edition of the¬†Productivity in Tech Podcast. I got to ¬†review the Trigg Life Mapper¬†and I thought we would do a special episode in honor of their KickStarter starting September 20th.

The Trigg Life Mapper¬†(or Trigg for short) is a colorful diary that helps you to plan your life. It focuses on Productivity, Mindfulness, and Work/Life Balance.

On this special episode I sat down with Trigg founder Matthew Bennet to learn more about him and his amazing notebook.

item.itunes:subtitle: For the past few months I've been testing a scheduling tool called vyte. Several of the latest interviews were scheduled using vyte and I must say I'm quite impressed. Not just with the product but with the team that runs it. I sat down with Martin...
item.description:
For the past few months I've been testing a scheduling tool called vyte. Several of the latest interviews were scheduled using vyte and I must say I'm quite impressed. Not just with the product but with the team that runs it.

I sat down with Martin St. Macary the company, one of the product's creators. It would be way too easy to talk about his product so instead we talked about why the need for such a product some of his own tricks to for handling meetings.

Martin St. Macary

item.title: PIT 25: @Saronyitbarek Asks About Productivity with Body Issues
item.itunes:subtitle: SoloSaturday is the show where I jump on the mic and talk about whatever in the world of productivity I feel like.¬† This week Saron Yitbarek (@saronyitbarek) asked us this question: How do you stay productive when your body isn't cooperating? ...
item.description:
SoloSaturday is the show where I jump on the mic and talk about whatever in the world of productivity I feel like.¬†

This week Saron Yitbarek (@saronyitbarek) asked us this question:

How do you stay productive when your body isn't cooperating?

¬†

Interesting Articles about This:

You Are Not A Machine¬†- ThatMacNerd

sleep-debt¬†- Hectic-Dad.com

¬†

Both articles emphasize taking care of yourself.

I have three points that I share with you.¬†

¬†

  1. Address or Alleviate the problem immediately
  2. Reduce the amount of Time and Energy spent on the work you do
  3. Give yourself some slack and take it easy.

¬†

Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

Follow us on:

¬†Twitter - @prodintech¬†

Jay Miller - @kjaymiller

Join the 150+¬†Facebook Group Members - productivityintech.com/fb

¬†

Help Share Productivity in Tech:

Give us a rating on iTunes,¬†

item.itunes:subtitle: This is part one of my two part conversation with Craig Harrison. Craig is a Data Manager by day and professional photographer by night.¬† With this split life, there are a lot of things Craig has to keep track of. ¬†So much stuff we had to...
item.description:
This is part one of my two part conversation with Craig Harrison. Craig is a Data Manager by day and professional photographer by night.¬†

With this split life, there are a lot of things Craig has to keep track of. ¬†So much stuff we had to split the show in half.¬†

This week we are talking about his day job and how he deals with all the data and tasks that come his way.

Craig Harrison

  • Photography
  • Twitter

Ask¬†us your questions

Send us a tweet @ProdTechPodcast and use the hashtag "#PITQuestions" and our productivity hounds will research and try to find an answer to your question.

item.itunes:subtitle: I've been hitting it pretty hard. So hard that I got sick. Well I decided that it was time to do something.¬† Hence the introduction of #SoloSaturday.¬† SoloSaturday will be every fifth episode and it will be about whatever I'm thinking...

item.title: PIT 4: Learning as you Go with Craig Lang
item.itunes:subtitle: I would love to learn a new skill. Maybe even change professions one day. I don't think I would want to do both at the same time.¬† This is what former electronic engineer turned software developer had to do.¬† Listen to how Craig managed to...
item.description:
I would love to learn a new skill. Maybe even change professions one day. I don't think I would want to do both at the same time.¬†

This is what former electronic engineer turned software developer had to do.¬†

Listen to how Craig managed to become a lead software developer over the span of 13 years and how he used his growing knowledge to increase his productivity along the way.¬†

¬†

Shameless Plugging

If you want to hear the entire hour plus conversation, consider pledging $1 or more a month to our Patreon Page.¬†

Be sure to ask us some productivity questions on twitter using the #PITQuestions Hastag.¬†

While you're there make you follow us.

@ProdTechPodcast

@kjaymiller
